result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI Cause Injury (2+) and PAC Cause Injury (2+). The defendant was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+) and the other charge, PAC Cause Injury (2+) was dismissed by the court.

  • Joshua L Somers was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

12/8/2016 - PER LETTER FROM DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS, DATED DECEMBER 1, 2016, DEFENDANT IS TO OWE THE $250.00 DNA SURCHARGE BASED ON THE DATE OF VIOLATION.  

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Not to operate a motorcycle without a valid driver's license.

filed by the State

Defendant Joshua L Somers in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 4 years 6 months (Initial Confinement: 18 months - 124 days credit, Extended Supervision: 3 years) - consecutive to any sentence defendant is serving
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration after defendant serves 9 months of his sentence 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program after defendant serves 9 months of his sentence 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision 
- Restitution of  $4122.00 to be paid to Ledell P. - stipulated to -  as a Condition of Extended Supervision
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of Extended Supervision: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  Not operate a motorcycle without a valid driver's license. 
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting to be determined - to coordinate a meeting with his Agent
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Town of Oconomowoc Police Department to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Sentencing hearing on September 8, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Joshua L Somers in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed. Reading waived.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Cts. 2, 4 and 5 dismissed by operation of law. Ct. 3 dismissed and read-in. Court will give a separate date for sentencing so the victims can be present. Court orders bail revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
